website_summaries.verdict: This K-Cup pod brewer is easy to use but has plenty of features so it can deliver a premium coffee experience with a fresh cup every time.
pros: 3 cup size options allow for a customizable brew
Hot water option is great for tea drinkers or making ramen
Makes fresh coffee at the touch of a button with a variety of K-Cup options to suit many tastes
A fill it yourself K-Cup is available for eco-conscious users
cons: Occasionally needs to be descaled to prevent clogging

customer_reviews.title: Love it / Hate it
customer_reviews.text: I've had three Keurigs over the years. This one is better than the other two (both were the original, I don't know the model number), in that it's quieter. Noticeable quieter. Brewing is about the same (which I like). BUT, about 20% of the time, this doesn't work at all. The pump (I guess) makes noise and either doesn't do anything or brews a few drops only. The problem didn't start until after a few months, but I wish I still had my old one. Truth is, I'd seen other reviewers saying the same thing, but I hoped for the best - wish I'd listened. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Joe American

customer_reviews.title: Java Made Simple!
customer_reviews.text: This is what made me a fan of coffee. Perfect one-cup for when you need it instead of a pot you'll end of wasting. In the long run, you'll save money, so this is an investment. I use the re-usable cups, not the Keurig brand but a compatible one. Got a 4 pack for around 10 bucks on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Short Beard

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work consistently...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased first keurig with extended warranty in November 2016. I use only distilled water and descaled and changed the filter regularly. First one stopped making a full cup early June 2017. On June 7 amazon shipped me a replacement. Today, one day - after their return policy - this 'new' one has started making only half cup coffee. I have tried cleaning three times, no luck. Lets see if amazon or keurig honors the original warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Burned
customer_reviews.text: This product worked fine for a while, but now, after about6 months, it is not working right. No matter what setting I have it on it brews less than a full 6 oz cup. I have tried cleaning it to no avail. I thought I bought an extended warranty but apparently not. I have looked over the product description and most small appliances like come with a 1-year warranty, but it does not look like this does. I am out in the cold. I feel like I got burned. I will never buy another Keurig brewer of Amazon again. If I bought this at a store, I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy with this unit. I don't always get a full cup of coffee and the Kuerig is only a few months old. Despite using a filter in the water tank, filtered water and cleaning it, it still doesn't work properly. I googled the problem and this seems to be a fairly common issue. The recommended resolution was to turn it over and smack it a good one! I love the convenience of the machine but if this continues I will have to go with a different method for my morning Java.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vick

customer_reviews.title: Only worked a week.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a week. Only makes noises and nothing brews. I got a replacement and the replacement doesn't even work. It will brew really slow and only about an inch in the cup. I bought it on sale for black Friday. I can't even get a full refund. They are only offering an Amazon account credit.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Moritz

customer_reviews.title: NO. Just NO.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older model that had lasted for years (over 7) at my office. This model failed after 3 weeks, making only half mug each time, which is exactly why I trashed my old Keurig. Further, as many have stated, it is noisy, and doesn't show that it needs water until after you have pushed the flashing blue button (and left the room, only to find that it has t brewed a thing). IDK what the engineers of this we're thinking, but it sucks. Amazon is thankfully sending me another one, but I fear the worst. I have no desire to trek in jugs of distilled water as someone earlier mentioned was in the fine print.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Welsch, DVM, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning did not good. The last Keurig I purchased had the same ...
customer_reviews.text: The lid to where you put the k cups did not stay up from the day I purchased it. After about 2 months it started having issue with filling the cups to required levels and makes a horrendous sound when filling the tank. Cleaning did not good. The last Keurig I purchased had the same issue of filling the cups within a short amount of time from purchase. I have cleaned them out as instructed and they work for about a week or so and start acting up again. I am returning to a regular coffee pot this time around!
customer_reviews.author: SUE KILLIAN

customer_reviews.title: Machine was used for 3 months to make 2 cups ...
customer_reviews.text: Machine was used for 3 months to make 2 cups of coffee on the weekend, and it broke. Swear it made no more than 25 cups of coffee before shutting down. This is the second machine we've had in the past 3 years. Don't buy a Keurig. They're made to break, and Amazon will not accept returns after 1mo. If you must buy a Keurig, buy it at Costco or Bed Bath and Beyond as they will take back replace your broken machines. They will break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last long
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2. The first one lasted a year. I cleaned it as recommended but it started making less and less coffee. After 6 or 7 months. I took the machine apart after watching some YouTube videos and it lasted another 4 months. The second machine started making less coffee after 3 months. I "fixed" it and it lasted another 2. I'm done with it. I got a Hamilton Beach dual machine. So far...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: We had an older model of this for almost 6 years that worked great, so when it bit the dust, I simply bought the newer version of the same model. This thing is a piece of junk. The water level has to be just right, it won't tell you there's not enough water in it until after you started the brewing process. When it does work, it'll make noises for 3 minutes before it begins to brew and often will brew less than a 1/3 of a cup. Total garbage and $90 down the drain. I've gone back to French Press which takes less time and is definitely more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: HollywoodHillbilly

customer_reviews.title: As pictured!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but came in a nice, undamaged package promptly. Protective packaging inside, also included was unsweetened iced tea (3pack) and coffee and hot cocoa (4pack) the product itself has no scratches or esthetic issues. Tape was even folded over for easy removal from product . Overall satisfied for a first time Keurig buyer :)
customer_reviews.author: Karyn Chechotka

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a toy....Update as of Jan 3, 2017 it no longer is working!!!
customer_reviews.text: They are definitely making their product the cheapest way possible. I had the same model prior. This one lacks in quality. I will use it till it fails, then checking out the competition! Things that were stainless are now plastic. The mechanical movements are not smooth. Always think I'm gonna break it. Feels like a toy. Jan 3 2017 JUST AN UPDATE: This coffee maker has already stop functioning!!! I will never buy anything made by Keurig! It is a worthless investment that does not perform for any legitimate length of time. I am most sincerely disappointed in the machine. I am going to see if the dealer will reimburse me for my loss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO frustrated!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for 2 days and now it isn't working!!! Now will have to call Customer Service. the water isn't going thru the k-cup. I've wasted 4 k-cups trying to trouble shoot this stupid thing!! My brother has one so I know it is a good machine. Maybe I got a dud? It worked great yesterday...today it won't push the water thru to make the coffee...it just dribbles. So so frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: DLW

customer_reviews.title: I purchased the warranty but that seems to be a waste of 11 more dollars
customer_reviews.text: really unhappy with this. It only worked a few times and then stopped working. It was a birthday gift for my husband. I purchased the warranty but that seems to be a waste of 11 more dollars. Its sitting in my kitchen taking up space and hubby is buying coffee at Starbucks. Big bummer. Anyone want to buy a stockpile of K-Cups? I cant use them
customer_reviews.author: sandy martin

customer_reviews.title: this model Keurig is crap
customer_reviews.text: I ORDERED THIS ON 8/11/17 DID NOT LAST 3 MONTHS!! I will not purchase it again!!! Had to call KEURIG 5 times and even the replacement they sent I have had to work on twice and I just received it at Thanksgiving!!! I am so over this coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.author: KATHERINE GREEN

customer_reviews.title: Broken Already
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Keurig right from the start. Unfortunately, this morning, less than a month old, it has already stopped working. So, now I have to somehow figure out a way to box it up to return it. Do I take a chance on another one, now that I'm hooked?
customer_reviews.author: JulieP

customer_reviews.title: Light use and still broke.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not even a huge coffee drinker but we decided to get one for the rare occasion. I have had this since August on 2016. At first I used it nearly daily for a week, then tapered off to occasionally, like I said not a big coffee gal. Well, this morning I turned it on and suddenly it sounds like a factory is hard at work but nothing is actually happening. I turned it off and on, I checked the water. No lights were on, except the power light. I am exceedingly disappointed in this product. I do not recommend a machine that, with light use, still breaks at just over a year old.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the Keurig machine I had for 7 years with this one. This machine is all plastic - no clock, no timer to keep it on during the day for a set time, and the cover to the water tank is scratched from the tape they used to secure it for shipping. The tray the cup sits on easily slips out of place. It is tremendously disappointing, and I am officially looking for something with better quality. Does it make ok coffee? Yes, I guess so, but this thing is cheaply made and I don't expect it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable. Stopped working in under TWO MONTHS!!
customer_reviews.text: I really love Keurigs. I know, I know, they are awful for the environment, and I try to balance that out by no meat mondays and rejecting all straws. I have owned 4 Keurigs and they all seem to give up the ghost after 2-3 years. No big deal. They are cheap enough to replace. But this mother effer worked for under two months. I purchased on Oct 13, used it for the first time Oct 17 and it is now Dec. 10 and it powers off 30 seconds after I ask it to brew a cup. I don't know if it's refurbished or what- but I'm going with the latest model.
customer_reviews.author: Libby Rome

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for more than 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working. Not even a year old. Around September, the large cup was putting out 1-2 ounces af most. We have cleaned, descaled and wasted more pods than I care to think about. Does not work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mr. K
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this machine! Easy to use, easy to clean & maintain. ...fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Kuerig’s aren’t worth buying, they break down, fast!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping Kuerig had started to make a better product, but it hasn’t. I purchased this coffeemaker on the 18th of August and have used it for about 2 weeks and the thing is plugged, I bought their cleaner product ( just for this problem) and it doesn’t clean out the coffee maker, it still doesn’t work. Since I’m past the 30 days to return to Amazon, I’m screwed. This review is for those of you considering purchasing this coffee maker, don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: kmbphx

customer_reviews.title: THE starter Coffee maker to buy. Period.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Super easy to setup -K-cups are dirt cheap here on Amazon -K-cups offer insane variety. Hot chocolate, Tea, and of course coffee. -Water is heated automatically, and reheats it over time. Easy to fill, easy to clean and maintain -You can buy a separate Cup to brew your own coffee into this and it works very well. Dare say taste better than most basic coffee makers Cons: -A bit bulky and big This should be THE starter coffee maker to get. No ifs, Ands or Buts, unless you're looking for something better which Keurig has you covered.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: KEURIG FAILS TO MAKE COFFEE
customer_reviews.text: Keurig coffee maker is malfunctioning, has been for a month or more. It is not working now. I paid using credit card that provides 3 year warranty, so it is still under warranty. The problem is - when the water is heated sufficiently to brew coffee, and with coffee pod in place, after lifting the handle, the lights blink; choosing one light (e.g., large for coffee) causes the unit to audibly cycle and then fail with top blue light ("add water") blinking despite the fact that the reservoir is nearly full. BAD UNIT! I NEED REPLACEMENT.
customer_reviews.author: R. MCBAIN

customer_reviews.title: Not great for single life when you can brew one cup at a time fresh and easy, but for a family it's a good deal
customer_reviews.text: Kind of big for what it is, but I suppose it doesn't know I could live with half the water and a little slower brew time. Coffee comes out well and I can usually find 10 k cups for 6 bux, so I end up breaking even for those days I don't go to the coffee shop to have them brew me a professional cup and a treat. Takes about 75 seconds to heat the water, and 60 seconds to brew the cup. I use distilled water so the included carbon filter isn't necessary, but good to have I guess. Not sure why it's so expensive. 3 times what the price should be given the materials!
customer_reviews.author: pablo

customer_reviews.title: More durable than newer models
customer_reviews.text: I had the Keurig 2.0 and it started to malfunction, so I researched the best Keurig and this one came highly recommended. It seems like older models of items last longer due to the fact that they don't have the digital screens. The coffee comes out hot and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Christina N.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Keurig type machine, but I didn't want to spend too much. This is affordable, compared to the other models, and it nothing fancy, but it does the trick! It gives me great coffee, and is really easy to use. It also comes with cleaning directions, because we know that these things can get gross! Highly recommend if you are looking for a basic, affordable version of the Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great Price but has missing information in the product details
customer_reviews.text: We definitely like the coffee maker. We have two of these units, both exactly the same model. The product details do not let you know that the filter kit is not included. This fact would have been nice to know so that a customer can buy the filter kit. The filter kit is ~$13.00 on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: SueB

customer_reviews.title: Red is very pretty
customer_reviews.text: What can you really say about this coffee maker. The red is very pretty. Wish they lasted longer. This is my third one. If you get the needle needs to be cleaned message, it's usually the end of the maker in my experience. Follow the instructions but don't bother to call if it doesn't work because you get the CSR telling you she really has no further information other than what is in the instruction book. Really for what we pay for the pods they should give the coffee maker free. Still convenient for a fast cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Pat B.

customer_reviews.title: but will get the better model when we need to buy another one or ...
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this model of Keurig again. The cup holder of our unit that we bought will not stay in the up position when opened so you have to use two hands to insert a pod. I don't think the coffee is as hot as our other one that we had before the pump failed in the unit. Also have some issues once in a while where it will not brew a cup of coffee until you unplug it and plug it back in; sometimes you have to do it a few times.This is a less expensive model, but will get the better model when we need to buy another one or look at other manufacturers altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Larry the Photo Guy

customer_reviews.title: Just Add Water? Keurig quality is gone.
customer_reviews.text: Have put 4 cups of coffee through this machine and now it will not quit saying Add Water. We got this as a replacement after we sent back the junk 2.0 that spit grounds into every cup of coffee. We’ve had this less than 24 hours and it will not brew. The reservoir is full and it keeps saying Add Water.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: For what it's worth, it does what it promises
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and I'd say it's pretty ideal to use in offices. For me, I was using it only for myself but it's not a necessity which is why I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product as it is Crap. The FIRST one I bought NEVER turned on the brew light so I exchanged it. This one worked for about a WEEK except the 2nd cup I brewed was about 1 inch of liquid in the bottom of the cup with the entire pod contents in it. Now today, the brew lights are not coming on on this one either. I DO NOT Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Garbage! Junk! Do not buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This unit made weird sounds when we first got it. I should have returned it. Refurbished you say? I say you are absolutely lying!!! I buy about 30 items per month on Amazon.... I am horrified to be stuck with this piece of crap. I have learned by lesson and hope I can spare others some grief and also save you some money. DO NOT BUY REFURBISHED!!! It is 100% JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Basic but not all that reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have had two Keurig coffee makers in he past but decided to go with this basic model K55 as I really don't need all the extras. However with that said, I have found this basic model to be unreliable. There is something not quite right with the water pumping mechanism that gets the water from the reservoir into the machine so it can heat and dispense into the cup. Only after removing and resetting the water reservoir numerous times can I get it to work properly which is quite frustrating when you just want a quick cup of coffee to start your day. In addition it is quite noisy when operating.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: It had slow leak right out of the box. ...
customer_reviews.text: It had slow leak right out of the box. Countertop had standing water every morning. Leak eventually stopped for reasons unknown. Now won’t heat water sometimes, makes loud noise, won’t show that it’s ready to brew. Tried unplugging, turning off and on, etc. sometimes it starts to work, other times not but eventually resets. Product is passed return or service date. I’ll order another one: just not from this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Hannadog

customer_reviews.title: Quality control problems
customer_reviews.text: This was the 2nd K55 I bought. The first one was a refurbished/used, bought through Amazon. It broke down after just 3-4 months. I thought maybe that's what I got for trying to save a few bucks buying a used one. So I bought a new one here. It too broke down after 4 months. I didn't want to go through the hassle of trying to use the warranty, packaging (I hadn't kept the original packaging) and mailing the thing. Two failures in less than a year was enough to convince me Keurig has quality control problems. Bought a simple Chulux, and it chugs along just fine. No "well" or programming, but that means fewer things to go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Defective, right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The Keurig arrived defective/damaged. Waste of time and effort. Have to ship it back. If you think yours has arrived damaged as well (my first clue was that it doesn't stay open, but it also sounded wrong when filling with water) you can check how they are supposed to be at a place like Bed Bath and Beyond. The K55's in store seem fine. This one was not. I would not buy from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's big but could almost run a small cafe cart.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to save counter space, this ain't the one. It's bigger than many regular brew machines even. But if there's more than one coffee drinker in the place - this one almost does commercial duty in taking care of everyone - using pods. I can see why so many offices have these. And I'm assuming it'll be reliable. Only had it a month or two after two other k-pod failures from unknown machine brands. On a side note; I bought some reusable pods and it didn't care for them, (leaked around top seal),. If reusable pods are only filled about half-way, then they work sometimes. We use both kinds of pods. Would we buy it again. Yes.
customer_reviews.author: J.Perkins

customer_reviews.title: yes
customer_reviews.text: I really like this, makes great coffee. Only thing I don't like is pulling out, filling, and putting back the water holder. I took a permanent marker, and put a line on the water holder to show the maximum fill line, then I took a 4 cup measuring cup and filled it with water and poured it in. Much easier! After owning mine for five months, I must say I am so happy. No more coffee grounds in my coffee. Fast, good coffee. Wish I had one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Love Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this if you have a water softener.  It won't work.
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this and have softened water you'll need to purchase and use bottled water. THAT NEEDS TO BE CLEAR ON THE PRODUCT DESCRIPTION AND HAVE A BIG WARNING LABEL ON THE BOX. We bought of one these and had to send it back because it was defective and would intermittently fail to brew, like every other cup. We got a second one which had the same problem. We called Keurig and were told to not use softened water as it would cause the machine not to fail!! Wow!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pat8

customer_reviews.title: Works great and Keurig stands behind their warranty 100% and beyond.
customer_reviews.text: Switched back to Keurig “1” after a couple of years of fighting with a cantankerous Keurig “2”. Never really used the option to brew a while carafe anyway so I didn’t mind losing that option. Worked great for 5 and a half months before the “Add Water” light started coming on and never going off. If you’re curious why a device that failed after 5.5 months has a 5* review, it’s because of their support. I tried some online options for resolving the issue but could not. Called support, 10 minutes later, a new machine was on its way to me. Keurig support is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Daughtry

customer_reviews.title: Needed a New Keurig and Not Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a big fan of Keurigs for quite a while, and sadly, after many years, I needed to retire my old one and upgrade. Compared to my old one this has a larger tank, comes with a super convenient auto-off feature, and my personal favorite, a descaling feature. Used to clean my old one by running vinegar through it a couple times and I'm looking forward to my kitchen not smelling of vinegar. lol All in all I'm extremely pleased with my new Keurig and now think I should've upgraded sooner. Whether your a new customer or long-time Keurig fan, you can't go wrong with this model!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Quick Delivery, great packing but......
customer_reviews.text: I suppose nothing is made like it used to be. This arrived over night or in two days......and it more colorful than my last Keurig. I cant tell you the last model but it was the same as in cup sizes. HOwever, that one lasted for 10 years or more. It had metal on it, looked classy. This one is totally plastic, and while much brighter red......and quieter.......I am doubting it will last as long as it is totally plastic. It only makes 3 sizes and the overfill that the cup sits on will surely not hold the largest size cup ( when you forget to put the cup under to catch Your coffee.)
customer_reviews.author: sue s

customer_reviews.title: JUNK.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this model 0 stars if I could. I've had 2 of these in the past 6 months and they both stopped working properly within a month. It won't dispense coffee so I waste k cups or it won't warm the water. Sometines if I shake it while it's brewing I'll get a half a cup out, sometines just a shot such a disappointment because the first week they were both so grear. I unplug them, shake them, anytbing I can do to get it to wprk again but nope. I would thought maybe one was just defective but 2 within 6 months? Piece of junk and I really love keurigs. Buy a different model.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly carroll

customer_reviews.title: Love ❤️ love 💕 Love 💗 Excellent price excellent quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Love 💗 Love ❤️ Love 💕 this Keurig not just for how awesome it is in terms of quick coffee and great addition to my home office but the color is just gorgeous!! Great price Great Keurig!! Excellent quality I use it ALOT!! And it’s still working like the first day I used it!! And color is awesome ordered a second one for my kitchen !!!
customer_reviews.author: PilatesMommy

customer_reviews.title: No auto-brew at set time
customer_reviews.text: Unless I'm missing something... this "Programmable" maker DOES NOT include option to brew coffee automatically at a programmed time. Had I known I would not have purchased. I do see in a description blurb, programmable refers to another function. So, I guess, shame on me? I'm no engineer, but a term such a's programmable often refers to something taking several steps like setting a time for auto-brew. In this case, doesn't feel appropriate that term is used to describe what can be a one-step feature.
customer_reviews.author: Sean F. Temoney

customer_reviews.title: I don't drink coffee every day but like one once in a while
customer_reviews.text: I received my Keurig for Christmas. I don't drink coffee every day but like one once in a while. I had used it maybe 6 times - then one day it didn't work. No reason. It just stopped. No water was being dispensed. I called the factory and they sent me a "needle cleaner" for free. I had already checked all the orifices and nothing was clogged. I turned it off. Unplugged it thinking it might reset itself. Nada. So now I'm stuck. What a lousy thing to happen to a brand-name product. Between the troubles I have experienced with Cuisinart products, LG refrigerators w/ice machines and now my coffee maker, I'm fed up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I was the guy that would stop by a coffee shop every morning before work to grab a coffee. This got very expensive and I finally decided to go with a Keurig. I absolutely love it and just recently ordered about 80 K-cups with different flavors to try. I use purified water from my refrigerators water dispenser. Hopefully this makes it to where I do not have to clean it as often. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H

customer_reviews.title: All my caffeine fiends, stand up!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I’m just a fiend for caffeine! After reading these reviews I feel like I should be satisfied with my machine- but I’m not :( I’ve had my Keurig for well over a year now. Needless to say I’ve given it the benefit of the doubt. I’m bout ready to go back to trusty old Mr.Coffee and filters. My only complaint that I can no longer live with it is weak coffee. It taste great, looks great- but I’m still sleepy lol. It’s not strong AT ALL, and there’s no aroma. No singing the foldgers song as the coffee is brewing. This machine isn’t for the real caffeine fiends, I don’t think.
customer_reviews.author: Naja

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: The design of the unit almost guarantees that it will make the k cups explode creating a huge mess. The unit is not designed to be taken apart to be cleaned which ensures that if you manage to get a cup produced without grounds in it, there will still be grounds in in from the previous failed attempts. Older models seemed to run a little slower, which allowed the k cups to drain at about the same rate as they were filled. This unit seems to push more water more quickly ensuring that every k cup will explode from overfilling.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Kozlowski

customer_reviews.title: Good product, dissipating packaging
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when this arrived. The box was severely dented and beat up. Not at all what I typically get from Amazon. It wasn't the actual product box though, so I remained hopeful. However the Keurig box was also damaged. Luckily, Keurig typically packages their products very well, and my new brewer had no apparent damage. I've had it three or four days now and have made a minimum of one coffee each day. No issues whatsoever. Set up was a breeze, brewing is quick, results are delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Scott Kimzey

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk! Would even make 1/8 th cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of months the water wouldn’t dispense the correct amount of water as selected on the programmer. Select a large cup, you might get 1/8 th of a cup. You would have to open the lid to reset the programmer to dispense the water out again. Sometimes it would take 3, 4, or 5 times of resetting the programmer to get one cup of coffee. Sent it back in as defective. Company sent a new one.... same thing! Finally went back to a $20 Mr Coffee. Works like a charm. The Mr. Coffee one that is! The Keurig would even make a decent fishing weight!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: A Basic Keurig
customer_reviews.text: I like the color, and this unit performs adequately within its design specifications. Once you "get it", Keurigs are the preferred way to brew your own coffee, and this is a genuine Keurig. It does what it's supposed to do. Right now, mine is sitting in the middle of a factory where a lot dust filled air quickly settles into your standard Mr Coffee carafe, giving it that extra industrial flavor. The Keurig quickly makes a single cup, so there isn't enough time for the dust to settle before I get the lid on my mug. Nothing beats the taste of overpriced coffee made by 3rd world slave labor in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: f2x

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it zero stars , I would
customer_reviews.text: I’m embarrassed to say how many of these things we have bought since they came out . This one finally was the last straw , this one quit after 6 weeks . Listen up Keurig people , NO MORE . If you can’t make a product that will last longer than that , you need to quit . I have become pretty good at getting these evil machines back to brewing coffee . I have cleaned needles , flushed and cleaned coffee makers for the last time . I’m done with ya. -- 6 weeks , you got to be kidding me .
customer_reviews.author: KZ1961

customer_reviews.title: The first one was ok lasted a few years, ...
customer_reviews.text: The first one was ok lasted a few years, the second one only lasted a few months, the third one didn't last even that. I am fed up. However I did insure the last one. I really don't know if I want to get another .Any suggestions? Yes, mine clogged at the needle after a couple of months. Upon reading the reviews I think I found the answer. The needle is clogged and you have to unclog it with a paper clip. It worked. We will see how long this lasts. Thanks for the unclogging suggestion as I do love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: beverly miller

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 9 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This product I loved for 2months. Then it stopped working. It would turn itself off after it made the noises of running. However no water would be released into the Kcup or the coffee cup. I unplugged it and reset it several times. It would work for a day or two then it would stop. Now it has completely stopped. I turn it on and it immediately turns itself off. It’s now at a shop for repairs. Where it has been for 2weeks. The tech said they “think it’s the power cord but they can’t find a replacement cord”.
customer_reviews.author: Darc

customer_reviews.title: Problem model
customer_reviews.text: There are obviously problems with this model. After about 9 months it stopped working correctly. Unit worked for the first cup in the morning, then kept shutting off when making a 22nd cup. Less trouble when I turned off the auto shut off button. After 3 calls to Kuerig they agreed to replace it. Great. BUT I ran the first cup thru as instructed, then tried to make a 2nd cup. Same problem. Unit shut off. Husband came home and successfully made 2 cups. I will see how it works with the auto shutoff turned of. I am now looking for a different brand machine .
customer_reviews.author: Fuzz

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for several months, several cups per day. So far so good. I ran a bottle of cleaning solution through this week as a maintenance thing rather than because of being actually needed. I loved every feature of my Keurig Vue, but alas, it is discontinued, and not the cups for it are outrageously expensive and only found from resellers. Regular Keurig pods are available everywhere, so I am content with this machine now. I read all the reviews, and it seems like less is more with regard to fancy features.
customer_reviews.author: Carol R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Different model than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Buyers beware: this is NOT the model that has the (carbon) filter holder and it is not clear if it will accept a separately-purchased carbon filter holder. Keurig: you totally mis-advertised this. You might have fixed it now but get your act together. Neurogenic does not use model numbers or names responsibly. You call an item by the same name even when you change it. And you seem hesitant to use model numbers to help us consumers understand. To me, the carbon filter really makes for better coffee even though it’s a pain to change it every two months. So I don’t want this model and have bought and returned it twice. Shame on you keurig ! And thanks, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Picky

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned within 5 months of purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine on October 5th - it is hardly used (maybe once per week or so) and it has already malfunctioned twice. I ordered a new part, arrived, put it in, worked for maybe a month, now it won't dispense more than an ounce of coffee at a time. I've wasted many K-cups trying to get it to work. No way to get ahold of anyone at AMAZON for help whatsoever. . So, it basically lasted less than 5 months. I'm not a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Teena

customer_reviews.title: Original Keurig
customer_reviews.text: Sooo I didn’t realize I was buying the OG version of the keurig. I mean, this is generation 1 BUT with that said, it works perfectly fine. It’s a bit noisy and takes a bit to heat up. It was almost half the cost of the newest model so it’s a good value. I’ve had it for a few months now and have had no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Product not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product back in March and have not had it a year yet and it quit working. It said it needed to be descaled even though I have a water softener on my house. I bought the descaling solution in December and followed the directions using it as instructed. Needless to say after use it quit working. I originally had a Keurig for about six years before I purchased two more this last one has not lived up to my expectations. So I will not be purchasing one again for a long time. Very dissatisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away they dont work
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one in less than a month, they sent it to replace the keurig I ordered just like this one. Now this one does not want to work. I have done all the troubleshooting options I had my first Keurig for about 6 years, it seems like Keurigs just don't last like other coffee makers, but they are more expensive than many? Maybe Amazon has a bad batch of these? Save yourself the trouble and avoid this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CherryG.

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent and junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of junk. Husband just threw it and smashed outside due to its inconsistency of actually making a cup of coffee. Has been a pain in the neck since purchased. Unable to return due to not having original box... Do yourself a favor and purchase one of the more expensive ones. Our expensive original lasted four years. This specific model is a waste of your hard earned money!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Miller

customer_reviews.title: All Plastic. Base Doesn’t Sit Level.
customer_reviews.text: I work in a small office with clients daily. We have a K-Classic Keurig. Ours is about 8 years old. Very sturdy, well built. The brew button went out last Friday. We have drank a lot of coffee from this Keurig. I really wish we could fix it. So I ordered the same K-Classic from Amazon. Opened the box. It’s all plastic. Can lift it with one arm. The biggest problem is that it doesn’t sit level. No way to adjust it. Our clients use it as well. I’m afraid one of the clients will close the lid too hard and the Keurig will fall over on them. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed all the way around
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this model. Water container small, cups sizes small, water not as hot as it should be. It's clear their cheapening the machines. I've ordered a different model in the hopes it's better.....if not, going to have to look for another brand....So disappointed as we've been such fans of theirs.....
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: OK, but wish I'd purchased the larger Keurig
customer_reviews.text: After about 3 years the last Keurig stopped working - initially was able to unblock, however eventually we couldn't fix. That one was a replacement unit sent by the manufacturer after we had problems with our very first Keurig. This works fine (lol, at least for now) however I didn't realize the water reservoir was so much smaller than our prior unit. With 2 people having one or two cups of coffee each morning, it seems like I'm refilling it daily. Otherwise just happy to have the convenience of pod coffee vs. making a morning pot.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Ms. Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: Hoping that the seller sees this review as I don't see a way to contact them directly. I've been using these coffee makers for years and ordered this one but unfortunately didn't plug it in until recently. It shuts off in mid stream. It's a faulty unit. Hoping seller will replace it for me. My mistake was ordering well before I needed it so the return policy time ran out. I've purchased from this seller before and they have very good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Best Keurig yet!
customer_reviews.text: I love the convenience of Keurig and this is the 3rd one I’ve used and I love it. 3 things I appreciate about this model: 1) When your cup of coffee is pouring, when it’s done pouring, it stops dripping and the light goes off indicating it’s ready. Past models have continued to drip for 30 seconds. 2) Auto shut off feature is nice. 3) When it’s low on water, this model notices when you’ve added water and the light goes off without hitting any buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coffee Maker. Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: It was fine - good features - while it lasted. After 3 months it stopped working. Just kept turning off. There are no instructions to deal with the situation. No service centers. It is a $50 appliance so not worth too much effort. I got one from another manufacturer to replace it. Did not see another way to go. The one we have at work has gone 3 years so far, so you may be luckier than I was.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kavanagh

customer_reviews.title: This model is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I had my old Keurig for 7+ years and it worked great right up until the day it died. I bought this unit as a replacement. I’ve had nothing but problems with it since day 1. It shuts off for no apparent reason, sometimes several times in a row. It appears to flood the kcups with too much water causing the unit to overrun from the top of the kcup, filling the cup with grounds and spitting coffee all over the counter. Because I disposed of all the packaging and paperwork when I received it, I cannot return it. I kept hoping that once it was “broken in” it would work better, but 2 1/2 months later it’s actually worse.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Shanley

customer_reviews.title: Leaks everywhere, much cheaper than older models
customer_reviews.text: Can’t make coffee without it leaking all over my counter. Water runs over the top of the filter and down the inside of the brew area and into my cup—pretty gross. This didn’t happen with my several years old Keurig before the motor went out. I was using a non-OEM filter even. With the new one leaking, I bought a $15 OEM filter, tried reducing the grounds used, but the only way to get it to not leak is to hold down the brew arm the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but cheap
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how different this would be from my old one that I had for many years before the pump finally went out on it. This is a much cheaper model! It takes longer to heat and a lot longer to pour out a cup of coffee. If you are an occasional coffee drinker you should be fine, but my daughter and I really like our coffee! I will be returning this one and upgrading to the more expensive one. Fingers crossed the quality on that one will be as good as my old one.
customer_reviews.author: tlc87

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, big step down in Keurig Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is VERY light weight plastic. This is the first time I’ve bought a new keurig in 5 years and I regret it. They’ve clearly dropped the quality of materials they use. Anything on the older model that was metal is now plastic. Anything that was already plastic on the older model has been made even thinner. I’m sure the water tank would shatter the first time it’s dropped...which is more likely to happen as it’s small and once down to a 3rd full, demands more water before it will work again. If I could return it without the shipping cost, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The product itself is amazing. The Keurig is a little loud when it ...
customer_reviews.text: Almost a year later and I still would not reccomend this product. Save your money and get a regular programmable coffee maker. ***UPDATE*** I purchased the Keurig on November 23, 2017, and it stopped working April 8, 2018. Please be aware that half the drinks that this machine is supposedly able to brew are bad for it and clog it up. It is also a difficult machine to clean and fix. The product itself is amazing. The Keurig is a little loud when it brews, but that's okay. I deducted stars because the product did not come on time and I was not able to track my package.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Renee

customer_reviews.title: A good machine for he price.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Mini Keurig (Model K15) which produced lukewarm coffee, frequently blew grounds in the coffee cup or on the counter, and quit working entirely after 2 years. This machine (Model K55) takes up more space, but the coffee is nice and hot, and the water reservoir conveniently holds enough for five cups before refilling. So far, all the coffee grounds are staying in the pods where they belong. This appliance is mostly plastic and has a cheap look to it, but for the price, what can one expect? If it lasts more than 2 years I'll be very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Rea

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: It came on time and does its job as it's designed to. Easy to use and refill. It doesn't come with a filter as the older model did, but if you're using filtered water it doesn't make much of a difference. There's an optional Keurig filter system they make for this, so buy that as well if that's what you want. If you're looking to switch to Keurig for the first time, buy the reusable cups as you can still use the ground coffee you've been using. Plus, less wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: allen babauta

customer_reviews.title: Love this maker
customer_reviews.text: Being retired plus an old USN vet from way back when, coffee is my one vice. This machine allows a fresh cup multiple times a day. Still peeved the lid doesn't lock into place like my original machine years ago, but that is easily offset by the fact my favorite huge Yeti insulated cup fits under the spout with ease with no spillage. If they keep making them like this one I'll keep buying them so long as I am able to drink coffee.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Williams Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Keurig
customer_reviews.text: Great for an apartment or house where coffee is had occasionally. I love this Keurig because it hold the perfect amount of water to last me a couple of days and it is very versitile. It is not heavy or hard to move. It's easy to use and there are so many k-cup options. Perfect size for 1-3 people drinking coffee or tea moderatley without having to refill the tank every day. I would also reccommend getting the reusable k-cup from Keurig that will allow you to put your own ground coffee in the container and brew a single cup. Best Keurig for the value I believe.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction after a few months
customer_reviews.text: This started exhibiting the typical symptoms common with this model - not pumping water and only making partial cups. It was only used once daily and treated very gently. I was able to fix the problems for the first few months, but finally gave up when it failed only 2 weeks after the last repair. I believe one of the solenoid valves has now completely failed. For such a costly product, it should be much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Rob J

customer_reviews.title: It works but that whole "programmable" word... ...
customer_reviews.text: It works but that whole "programmable" word....ummm, no... there's nothing programmable about it. I thought I would be able to "program" it to make coffee at a certain time.
customer_reviews.author: SciFiDorkyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Beware: The Water Dispenser Doesn't Come Off ... at Least in the Keurig I received
customer_reviews.text: What did I like about this product? Well, I thought it was the same Keurig K-Classic Coffee Maker I've had for years. I've had it for a week now, and while I haven't the experiences of others who've rated it, I can't give this version of my old Keurig a 5 star review. While it is easy to use, it isn't easy to clean. No matter how much I push or tug, the water dispenser won't come off. Was it designed to do that? I doubt it. Might change the rating if the water dispenser EVER comes off. Meanwhile, I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: My sister owns one and I use hers every time I'm over but it took me years to decide to get one for myself. I'm so glad I did, and this one is simply perfect for me. Some days I only want one cup, and others I'm needing 3 or more so yeah, this is just what I needed and so many flavors available! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Grim Magazine

customer_reviews.title: Pure Class
customer_reviews.text: Our Old Keurig finally gave up the Ghost after 5 Years of Flawless performance.Since then we've gone with a Muted Red Color Scheme in the Kitchen so I Took a chance on this "Rhubarb" Color."NAILED IT"..This thing is "Exquisite"!!.The Packaging was Impressive so we will see how it Holds up.A Big 5 Star Thank you for now.Will update Later.
customer_reviews.author: Charlane Valade

customer_reviews.title: OVERUSED every single morning and it's always ready for more!
customer_reviews.text: We drink a LOT of coffee in our house, and our Keurig is the focal point of our kitchen every single morning. Probably my most-used and best-loved appliance (next to my beer refrigerator, maybe...) Dependable, reliable, and always makes a great cup of coffee. I keep mine next to the sink so I can refill the reservoir right from the sprayer instead of removing it to fill it. I replace the filter in the reservoir regularly and the coffee always tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: FireMedic

customer_reviews.title: A 'must-have" for coffee people
customer_reviews.text: Super efficient, water reservoir holds enough to make 4+ large cups before needing to be refilled. I've used mine for a few months and it hasn't went into "de-calcify" mode yet. Only negative about this thing is the noise level. It wakes up everyone in the house as it warms up and dispenses and I have actually heard it dispensing from the curb when I take my trash out (which doesn't really matter to me).
customer_reviews.author: Big Dog

customer_reviews.title: Best single serve coffee pot..i've bought plenty to know!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot lives up to the hype and i will but it over and over if it ever breaks. i purchased a few different single serve off brands, walmart, Mr. Coffee, fromage something or other and NONE of them hold a candle to the Keurig. this one is clean, fast, and your coffee tastes great, without any grounds, waste, under or over brewing. It is quality and super easy to clean as well. Love this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: It's a life necessity
customer_reviews.text: When I bought the same version of this coffee machine about five years ago, it was over $300. Now it's less than a hundred bucks. I use it every day and it works great. It is my rock. It gives me the strength to get through my day. Don't fall for the 2.0 version that forces you to use their socialized Green Mountain brand. This one lets you pick whatever kind of coffee you want. I prefer the Black Rifle Coffee CAF brand and that would not be possible on a 2.0 because Keurig doesn't make it. This is a quality coffee maker and it's big enough for a whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Moose

customer_reviews.title: Keurig purchase was a great move!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Keurig. I already had one but had taken it to work for everyone to use. Then I visited my best friend in Arizona and she had one. We used it so often I knew I wanted one for home again. My only regret is that I didn't investigate the features and get one with a temperature control. Other than that I just love having fresh coffee in the morning or any time during the day. I use the k-cup that you fill with your own coffee. This makes it much more affordable on a fixed income. Hot chocolate, tea, another coffee - all within the touch of a button. Great purchase and I LOVE the color.
customer_reviews.author: Mumsy

customer_reviews.title: Two strikes. You're out.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great until it didn't. This was my second Keurig to die prematurely. The first just out of warranty, I thought it was a fluke. The second lasted somewhat longer. Both quit under used and very well taken care of. Support at Keurig was no help either time, offering only a small discount on a new machine as compensation for my trouble. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: O.

customer_reviews.title: Unpredictable
customer_reviews.text: You never know how much coffee this model feels like making. Sometimes it fills the cup, sometimes it only gives you a half cup. (This happens when pressing the "full cup" button, so it's hard to say what the other buttons are there for.) No matter how much coffee it gives you, it doesn't come close to tasting like a good cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: David Robinette

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works, but faulty machinery
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical buying a Keurig because I have heard they need to be returned quite often but my husband insisted. I bought this in Sept and it's now February and I really wish I didn't make this purchase. It is a great machine when it works but it frequently has issues where it makes noise like it's drawing water and pouring but isn't doing anything. I've had to "reset" it about 4 times and will be contacting keurig this week to exchange it. If I could return it I would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks down after just a few years
customer_reviews.text: We bought the earlier version of this coffee maker (K55) back in 2017 and were very happy with it, with no issues. Then, suddenly this morning, it just stopped working. After running a few troubleshooting scenarios with customer service, she said there is nothing to be done and we'd have to buy a new one. We are hoping this newer model will last longer than 3 1/2 years. Based on the very high user ratings, this looks to be the best option so far.
customer_reviews.author: Creekside shopper

customer_reviews.title: Different Version of Same Model
customer_reviews.text: We liked the one we bought several years ago and when it stopped working, bought the same model. But somewhere along the line, some features were changed. What's different? The charcoal filter holder doesn't fit; the water tank doesn't attach as tightly; there is no overflow outlet into the water tank; the programmed cycle is different; the gasket on the upper needle isn't as thick or strong. The most important change was the gasket; we needed to add neoprene washers to our reusable pods to prevent water leakage out of the top. Secondarily was the filter holder, all else are minor.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great price- awesome coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! I had another (smaller) version that didn’t have a water reservoir and actually cost about $10 more than this one. When I moved to Jensen Beach FL I found that the water quality is different from anywhere else I’ve ever lived- for example, if you fill an ice tray with water out of the tap it will freeze a bit cloudy - I guess you’d call it hard water (totally safe by the way) and didn’t like the idea of not having a water reservoir that I could fill with bottled water. I donated my other coffee machine and replaced with this one- Super happy with it!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Jensen Beach

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly useful
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife (a coffee drinker) as a Christmas present. She loves it and uses it at least once a day. Every cup now comes out perfect,and she doesn't have to make a half pot or whole pot to do it. I was afraid it might end up as one of those things you buy, use a couple of times, and forget about. It has not. I believe that in the two months (62 days) since she received it, it has been used well over a hundred times. Various coffees, decaf coffees for guests, cappuccino, hot chocolate - it has done them all. Maybe next tey will invent Ramen for K-Cup.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Biddle

customer_reviews.title: Finally! A Great Coffee Experience.
customer_reviews.text: I tried several coffee maker brands, three in total in the last few months. They were okay and did the job, but I was not completely satisfied and said so in my reviews. But this Keurig Classic does it's job. It's clean, no mess, no fuss. I purchased plastic filter cups so that I may use my own grounds, when I choose too. I press two brew buttons, back to back to make a 14 ounce cup. The heating and brew cycles are quick and effective, so waiting isn't an issue. Nice, clean-tasting, hot coffee is exactly what I needed my coffee maker to do. And this machine does that. A great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nelly

customer_reviews.title: Defective lasted 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Keurig to replace our old one that lasted 12 yrs. After 6 weeks of being used twice a day it has started to shut off while trying to brew coffee. I don't know if it was just a defective machine or the quality just isn't the same anymore. Hoping I can return it. Update: I called Keurig & they are sending me a new Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Church

product_meta.title: Keurig K-Classic Coffee Maker, Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Brewer, 6 to 10 Oz. Brew Sizes, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackThe Classic Keurig K-Cup Single Serve Coffee Maker, and a perennial best-seller, the Keurig K-Classic brews a rich, smooth, and delicious cup every time with the quality you expect from Keurig. Simple touch buttons make your brewing experience stress free, and multiple K-Cup pod brew sizes help to ensure you get your perfect cup. Whether you like your coffee strong, mild, decaf, or flavored, you can brew all of your favorites with the Keurig K-Classic– and with large 48oz water reservoir, you can brew 6+ cups before having to refill. Discover hundreds of K-Cup pod varieties from all of the brands you love, including Green Mountain Coffee, Starbucks, and Lipton, and enjoy coffee, tea, hot cocoa and more. Also available in a two fun colors to complement your décor, and compatible with the Keurig Classic Series My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter, so you can brew your own ground coffee.

BRAND STORY
By Keurig
feature_bullets: Brews multiple k-cup pod sizes: (6, 8, 10 ounce) – the most popular k-cup pod brew sizes. Use the 6 ounce brew size to achieve the strongest brew.

Large 48 ounce water reservoir: Allows you to brew 6+ cups before having to refill, saving you time and simplifying your morning routine. The water reservoir is removable, making it easy to refill whenever you need to.
Descaling: An important part of cleaning your keurig brewer. This process helps to remove calcium deposits, or scale, that can build up inside a coffee maker over time.
Auto-off: An auto-off feature is easily programmed to turn off your coffee maker after it has been idle for two hours, helping to save energy.
Simple button controls: Just insert a pod, select your desired cup brew size, and brew a great-tasting cup in under a minute.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars28,821 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
